title: Excel & Google Sheets Scoring System Expert – Custom Matching Logic
job_overview:
???? Job Title:
Excel & Google Sheets Scoring System Expert – Custom Matching Logic

???? About the Project:
We’re building a data-driven platform in the college recruiting space and need a spreadsheet expert to help implement a custom scoring and matching system. The system will analyze multiple data points and return a ranked list of best-fit options for users based on defined logic and weighted inputs.

We already have the framework and data structure. Now we need someone to help bring it to life in Excel or Google Sheets using formulas, conditional logic, and smart automation.

???? What You'll Do:
Build out a flexible, reliable scoring model using Excel and/or Google Sheets

Normalize and score various data types from different sources

Create logic to return ranked matches based on predefined criteria

Help clean, structure, and connect datasets within the spreadsheet

Ensure scalability and accuracy for future additions

???? Key Skills Required:
Advanced proficiency in Excel and Google Sheets

Strong understanding of formulas, scoring systems, and conditional logic

Ability to structure data for matching or recommendation tools

Clean, organized spreadsheet design and documentation

Strong communication skills and attention to detail

???? Bonus Skills (Not Required, but Nice to Have):
Experience with performance evaluation tools or matching systems

Airtable or Notion familiarity

Interest or experience in sports, education, or student platforms

? Timeline & Scope:
Estimated workload: 15–30 hours

Looking to hire immediately

Potential for ongoing work after initial project if there's a strong fit

???? Compensation:
Open to hourly or fixed-rate proposals

Preference for applicants in the Philippines or similar time zones, but open to all

? To Apply, Please Include:
Examples of past spreadsheet projects you've completed (especially scoring or logic-based work)

A short description of your experience with complex Excel/Sheets logic
